result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L Turner Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Duty Upon Striking Occupied or Attended Vehicle (Great Bodily Harm) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Hit and Run-Involve Injury [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements.  Court ordered monies taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance would be then be paid while on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.
-Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for one day.

superMiscConds.notes: AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  No controlled substances or alcohol.    Random urine screens to ensure compliance.

supervisions.notes:
03-09-16/ Judge Jeffrey A Conen
The Court ordered that the JOC is amended to change the extended supervision for count one to five years and the total length of the sentence for count one to eleven years.

Court advised defendant:   that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms;  and his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Duty Upon Striking Occupied or Attended Vehicle (Great Bodily Harm)

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one.
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration  and Wisconsin Substance Abuse Programs after three (3) years of confinement.

Defendant Robert L Turner in court with Attorney Jeffrey J Guerard.  Defendant Robert L Turner in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a plea hearing.  AS TO COUNT #1 AND #2:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.

AS TO COUNT #3:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Matter set for sentencing February 5, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
